reviews.sentence: SO Relaxing. I loved this hotel for the balcony the grounds the free nightly drinks and the location. It is only 4 stories high with an open lobby and feels very welcoming. There are beach chairs and umbrellas free for daily check out and nice lounge couches and hammocks on the property. I liked the surrounding town and easy access to the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel on beach w nice features maids not great. The hotel has a really nice fire pit area for cool nights and nice swimming pool. The beach is rocky so it is not good for swimming but has a beautiful sunrise and is great for taking a walk. Chickens and roosters are abundant on the property will wake you up before sunrise if you stay on a lower level. We did not hear them much since we stayed on the 4th floor. There is a 20 daily resort fee added to your bill. We enjoyed the Sunrise Experience Hawaiian dance singing and conch shell horn ceremony at sunrise the hula fire knife show other singers in lounge area and art and jewelry make by local Kauai artists in the hotel lobby. Maids could not get it right once the garbage was not emptied twice the coffee was not left for coffee maker twice clean drinking glasses were not provided once the bath tub mat was not left and there were never enough towels given. Even though we tipped the maid it did not make a difference. It was aggravating after we were out all day and came back to our room tired and had to deal with something in our room. The air conditioning vent in the room blew right across the top of our heads while lying in bed. We ending up sleeping at the foot of the bed so we would not freeze or get a sore throat from cold air. The staff in the lounge bar were very nice and courteous. Sunrise Experience Hula Fire Knife show singers in lounge bar local Kauai artists selling art and jewelry in hotel lobby. maid staff need to make sure all things in the room are provided towels glasses coffee remove garbage etc. move air conditioning vent if possible. Longs Drugs next to hotel has everything including fresh produce food souveniers beach sandals towels nearby Safeway McDonalds Panda Express.

An excellent stay. This hotel provided everything that my family needed for our brief stay before leaving paradise. Clean rooms laundry facilities on the 2nd 4th floor beachfront great for scenery for kids to play on shore and close to airport Kapa. There is an additional resort fee per day for parking 14 or you can purchase the resort package 22 which includes yoga for 2 on the beach fantastic free mai tas they will even make them virgin for you beach chairs umbrella tennis equipment and kids eat free in restaurant with a paying adult. It definitely has a resort night life music every night feel if its your vacation style.
Mariot Courtyard Kapa. Wonderful stay here. Staff was great checking out towels and beach chairs was easy. Nice facility with a great pool and hot tub1 Right on the beach with a great view.

Great location quiet ocean front room was lovely breakfast banquet was worth the. The person woman salt and pepper hair glasses 52 ish who checked us in and out was truly one of the most gentle and welcoming I have ever met. EVER. She did an excellent job of orienting us to the facility and letting us know what we had available to us for our enjoyment yoga on the beach sunrise. bigger room breakfast. My husband even commented on her hospitality skills. Room was a little dark. Hallways a bit tired.

Good location. This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and the main reason to return is the bed so super comfy. Everything is close by nice restaurants supermarket and excellent facilities. Any requests were handled professionally and friendly by staff I can not fault my stay at all and will return again.

Our room accommodations had a great view of the ocean. The staff were also very friendly and helpful and more attentive to us and the other guests around us than we have usually experienced at other similar resorts in Kauai. Given all that there was a distinctive difference in quality between this Mariot vs the one by Poipu mostly seen in the lack of overall accommodations and amenities available to gold members but that seems to be what you had expect from the price difference between the two resorts as well.

Lovely place to stay. The room was very spacious and comfortable. There was no microwave but there was a small refrigerator in the room. The bathroom was very small and one needed to squeeze in to the side to close the door. I was there for 5 nights and slept well. There was not outside noise that disturbed and I barely knew that anyone else was there. Extremely lovely location and outdoor amenities. I knew I was in Paradise. The staff could not have been nicer nor more helpful.

A New Family of Loyal Fans. We had a booking error and arrived in Kauai late with nowhere to stay. We were exhausted and this hotel was a welcome retreat for our road weary bones. Thank you from a family of very grateful fansRelative to other hotels in the area this place was very reasonably priced especially considering the fantastic location and amenities. Staff was incredibly helpful and kind. There is something to be said for having someone pick up the phone when you are in need.

Anniversary 1 night inter island stay. Great check in. Great staff nice older accommodations but not functional or hygienic. Bathtub did not drain multiple checks to make sure. Called desk was asked if we wanted it forced tonight. Sure we came all the way to Kauai to switch rooms in the middle of a romantic anniversary night. Told the desk it ’s too late to do anything but that they need to fix the problem. No offer to. Move or refund on room. 2 hours later the tub is still full will not be able to bathe in the morning. Also cracked sink and blood on the door. Kind of scevie. Outside balcony covered in giant snails Hawaii snails transmit encephalitis. Had to sleep her for time buy ca n’t pay to stay here again based on the lack of any remediation or remuneration or a fix. Unfortunately I can not recommend this hotel. Deal or no deal the lack of repair makes it untenable as a “ 4 Star ” hotel.

Good base for exploring the island. The setting. You are 15 20 minutes north of LIH Airport. The property is 5 minutes south of the tourist hub of Kapa’a. There is a large Long ’s Pharmacy store just before the parking lot to the hotel with all the conveniences food drinks and beach needs one may want. They had great prices on macadamia nuts and local coffee. The property has a massive parking lot and when we arrived at 11 pm most of the spots were occupied. The spots are ruled very narrow I was afraid that our car would get dinged every time we parked. The main entrance was beautifully lit up at night. The reception area was a small nook in an otherwise large spacious and open air lobby. There was a bell hop station and a tourist desk near reception. The restaurant the serves breakfast is also off the lobby as is the bar and the entrance to the pool. We were upgraded from a garden view room to an ocean front room due to elite status with the hotel chain. However no one acknowledged our honeymoon even though I notified the hotel and even let the reception know after checking in. This was in stark difference to being congratulated at check in at the Courtyard in Kona. On the other hand we were impressed that reception waved the resort fee and gave us two free Mai Tai coupons due to our status. We also opted for the 10 person day food discount due to our status. The room. Our oceanfront room was at the end of the farthest building from the lobby. We had to walk through two wings to get to our room. There was a small lot next to our wing with an entrance to the building which was convenient. However it was impossible to access the beach or the grounds from our building one must walk all the way to the lobby in order to do so which is inconvenient and annoying. The room was huge and had a large king size bed a cabinet housing a flat panel TV the coffee maker and the mini fridge. There was no tea or tea maker in the room so if you bring your own be prepared for the taste of coffee in your tea from the coffee maker. There was a desk and chair as well as a couch with a coffee table. There was a large balcony directly facing the ocean. Watching the sunrise from the balcony was a beautiful moment. There was a yoga class at sunrise just under our balcony. The closet contained a safe. There was also a small bathroom and a second vanity with a sink just outside the bathroom. The water pressure in the shower was strong but the shower head was tiny. The toiletries were cheap Paul Mitchell brand. The décor of the room was dated and could use a refresher. The bathroom and vanity were badly dated and should be remodeled ASAP. The free WiFi worked great in the room and throughout the property and the TV had all the cable channels one would want. The laundry room was convenient but only accepted coins. The grounds. The pool was large and had a fire feature installed at its perimeter. The bar was just off the pool. There was also a large Jacuzi off the pool. The showers were oddly placed in the corner of the pool and were not easily visible from the beach. The pool area was nicely designed with modern touches. This was in stark contrast to the dated décor throughout the rest of the property. The beach here is beautiful but not swimable. There is a concrete wall built five feet from the edge of the water which keeps the surf from pounding onto the beach and eroding the sand. The strip of water from the beach edge to the concrete wall is very rock and one could easily get hurt entering or exiting the water. The narrow channel of water also has a serious undertow as the water which makes it over the breaker wall tries to escape back into the ocean. The landscaping fronting the beach is lovely with trees and green grass but this is not a swimable beach so beware. The food. We tried the 25 person breakfast buffet. This buffet is not worth the price tag it comes with. Selections are limited and you are much better off ordering a la carte. We enjoyed the Loco Moco an egg over a burger patty drowned in gravy with friend onions and mushrooms over rice. One item that annoyed me was labeling the breakfast syrup which is just high fructose corn syrup as maple syrup. This is not a five star hotel so I did n’t expect real maple syrup but mislabeling in such a way is unethical and must be stopped. I complained to the restaurant manager but this was not changed during the three days we were there. All in all we loved our spacious ocean front room and the cheap breakfast thanks to the 10 person day coupons we had. The location tends to get a lot of rain so use it as a base for your beach time on the southern side of the island. Do n’t book this place thinking you can just laze about and enjoy the beach here. It is rainy most of the time and too rocky to swim.

Where is the Managment. Stayed here for a week in March. There were some very nice things about this property and I really wanted to be able to give it a higher rating but the problems there are problems that should NOT have been. I am a big fan of Mariot properties because the training and the management is consistently Superior That is sadly not the case at this hotel. The Pros. Great location close to restaurants shopping Coconut Marketplace is walkable. Not too far from Airport after a long flight from the east coast. The renovated rooms which we had are very nice bright airy good bedding and towels. VERY large TV for folks for whom that is important. Grounds are pretty and fairly well kept see comments under Cons for why I do not give super high marks for the grounds. Easy parking plenty of spots. Free Valet if you want. The Cons In the week we were there there was never any staff walking around the pool keeping things tidy. Every time I sat down at a chair that had a table by it there were MANY empty plastic cups used plates etc. VERY yucky. Also I understand that the chickens are part of the culture they do not bother me at all but their po on the pool deck does. I sat in the same lounge chair 2 days in a row and had to avoid the same chicken droppings both times. They should be hosing down the pool deck nightly. Pool Chairs NOT ENOUGH. There are 23 lounge chairs yes I counted and that is just not enough for this property. Every morning people go down before breakfast and leave towels to reserve their spot. So if you come down at 9 or 10 no chairs. Another reason they were short on chairs was the large group of NON guests using the pool. I was seated next to a man at the pool on Saturday morning who was a guest he was on the phone inviting all his family and friends over to use the pool for the day. They descended on the pool well before lunch and stayed til about 6 pm. They took up 6 chairs and crowded the pool. They got into the hotel by walking right through the front lobby right past the security guard. What good is a security guard if people can just walk right into a hotel. If there had been hotel management staff coming through the pool area every once in a while they would have noticed this. It was clear through my conversation with this man that he does this fairly frequently he was planning on being back in 2 weeks. If this was a huge pool with plentiful seating I would not have minded as much. But for 2 days in a row I had to sit away from the pool in the afternoon in a chair rather than next to the pool in a lounger because Non guests were taking up so much room. Their kids also crowded out the hot tub all day because the pool water was too cool for them. Housekeeping was below par First day I asked her for extra towels and she gave me some off the cart. Next day when she cleaned she took them all and only left a couple towels. And she left no conditioner. So I went down hall and asked for more. Same thing the next morning and every morning. So for 6 mornings in a row I had to ask for towels and for conditioner. Her cleaning of the room was cursory. No new glasses cups. Never emptied and wiped down the ice bucket just left the water in it from the melted ice. Restaurant we ate one lunch and one breakfast at the hotel. At lunch although the waitress had removed our empty plates she never came back with a check. I had to go up to the bar and ask for our check. The bartender was annoyed telling me she did not wait on me. At breakfast the same thing happened and my husband had to go up to the hostess station and ask for our check. Again there was no restaurant manager around making sure people were doing there job. Since there was no management presence at the pool or in the hallway with the housekeeping staff or in the restaurants there was no one to easily chat with. I am on vacation I do not want to hunt down a manager. And it is not my job to make sure staff is doing theirs. So all in all this is a property with great potential but is currently failing. I hope that when they respond they do not tell me I should have talked to them. THEY should know what is happening and what is NOT happening at their property.

I hope that when they respond they do not tell me I should have talked to them. THEY should know what is happening and what is NOT happening at their property.

Mildew. The facility itself and staff were wonderful. The room not so much. It was clean and had all the normal room amenities but it smelled like mildew. Not just a faint smell overwhelmingly. No windows that opened. Thank goodness we were only there to sleep one night. And no there were no other rooms available.

Never been disappointed by Mariot before but unbelievably disappointed today. We showed up for the last night of our 30th Anniversary trip ready to enjoy one last night in paradise only to find the hotel torn up for renovations. no pool no hotub and no one had the decency to let us know prior to our arrival. Having a background in hospitality I completely understand the need to renovate and that it may will inconvenience guests but to blind side them is unacceptable. We spoke on multiple occasions to the hotel concierge they never said a word either. If we had known that construction was happening we would have not expected to arrive take a nice nap followed by a swim and hot tub with a cocktail prior to our dinner plans. We would have arrived after work was done for the day without expectations of amenities we expected being there. I hope this property will show future guests more respect. These renovations are going to take awhile.

Enjoyable Stay. I will concur with a majority of the reviews below about not being notified of the construction ahead of time. I booked over 6months ago for 5 nights on points. When I found out about the construction about a month before my stay reading reviews I started contact the hotel and was getting the run around about it and the lack of amenities. After not a lot of progress I contacted Mariot Bonvoy directly and finally got somewhere. Our room was amazing on a high floor in a corner and away from the construction. We did not hear any of it unles we were heading downstairs and to the lobby. The staff was very friendly at the front and restaurant. The food and 350 Mai Tais are great. The beach front is very nice and a lot of chairs for relaxation. We did go to the pool next door one day and its very nice but small. This place will be wonderful once they are done however not notifying guests a head of time and not offering to wave resort fees up front is not right. This hotel does not have all the amenities listed for that fee. I had to be very persistent to make my stay as enjoyable as it was. Again I thank the staff for my friends and I wonderful time in Kauai.

DO NOT STAY HERE. MAJOR CONSTRUCTION UNDERWAY. As of June 2019 I do not recommend that you stay here. First of all we were never informed that construction really its more like demolition was going on at the hotel and we booked back in February. They literally have an excavator and crane in the lobby of the hotel and there is lot of noise. There is jackhammers grinders and all kinds of equipment. I would have attached videos so that all of you could see just how loud the noise is but the site will not let me so see the photo below of this little boy covering his ears because its so loud. If you go in expecting a resort with a pool restaurant or anything else you would expect from a Mariot do not they have all been demolished. They informed us when we arrived that construction only last between 9 am 5 pm but on multiple nights we came back to the room and they were still hard at work at 730pm. They have this little side room they are calling a temporary lobby but wow they have cheap fold up tables and printed out pictures on the walls. I just could not believe it. By far the worst mariot I have ever stayed at but I am sure if you come here when the construction is complete it will be nice but who knows how far away that is. It was too late for us too move to a different hotel or cancel so please do not make the same mistake as us and go somewhere else.

One Night Only Thankfully. Our group of six stayed here on the night June 13th that we arrived in Kauai. When I checked us in the desk clerk asked if our travel agent let us know about the construction. I booked online and there was no mention of it. It was n’t that big a deal for us since we were only there one night in our way to our vacation rental the next day but I felt sorry for the other two parties checking in at the same time that were n’t told either about the construction and were there for a much longer period. I have to say that the Courtyard is doing their best of a bad situation. You can get a two hour voucher to neighboring hotel pool. They turned one of their reception rooms into a bar restaurant. It is however at least while we were there. a full blown construction site in many areas. Never been so happy to only been in a place for one night. The room however was very comfortable and clean. Surprisingly quiet for all going on in the hotel. I ’m sure once it ’s done it ’l be beautiful.

A Construction site to avoided. On arrival we entered the lobby and booked in. Then we found that there was no pools available as they were upgrading and it was a now a construction site. Restaurant and pool side bar unavailable as they were still being constructed renovated. We stayed in the north wing and found the closest lift access was not working due to being upgraded. The washing machines and dryers also did not work on our floor. If you want an early rest on sunday and thursday evening it is not going to happen as a make shift marque is located on the grounds for the luau with many non guests in attendance and loud music system. The manager made some minor attempts to placate us with a one off free breakfast for our 8day stay. They also had the hide to try and charge us 200 US a day as a resort fe no pools no bar no restaurants lots of construction noise they should have paid us to stay. Very poor having stayed at the Courtyard by Mariot throughout Australia East Asia and the UK this was the by far the worst stay. Very very poor.
It was under construction. Air conditioning was broken. Facilities were at a different hotel. Construction noise.

Updated clean. The property is newly updated from the lobby to the pool bar area to the rooms. It was also spotless. No bugs dust or grime. The ocean view was really nice although we did n’t find ourselves out on the patio often. The bar by the pool has yummy food and the area is also kid friendly. The staff was so sweet and helpful as well every morning we grabbed beach towels on our way out and was greeted with a smile. The beach it is on it not super swimable with reef rock close to the shore but there are plenty of beaches within a mile or 2. The price was a little steep but a clean updated room is well worth it.
Nice. But pricey. Worth it though for the accommodations and amenities.

Really beautiful hotel the staff was very nice helpful. The room was comfy clean. Very stylish relaxing atmosphere. Brezeway thru the lobby is very different. The bar next to the pool was the best. So relaxing.

Excellent location. Lots of delicious food and coffee options nearby. Beach was clean and nice although it was very rocky in most places definitely wear water shoes. The nearby public beach Lydgate was perfect for swimming. We got an updated room but lots of the hotel still under construction. The bathroom was rather small though and no bathtub so trying to bathe baby took some logistical planning. Also toilet is super load when flushing. Loud enough to hear your neighbors flushing. And no air circulater in the bathroom so bring some air fresher. Staff very nice and accommodating. Storage room where the baby cribs are kept definitely had cockroaches so we declined the crib. Did not see any roaches in our room or the hallways. As long as you do not leave any food out you will not attract any bugs. Self service laundry was very expensive. No place to fill up water bottles and coffee only available during early hours unles you order through the restaurant or room service. The pool area was renovated and gorgeous also very slippery. Cellular service was spotty in certain places.

Inconsistent service windy beach and not so updated refurbished old hotel. Definitely not up to Sheraton standard. I spent a week with my family 2 kids 10 12 at Sheraton Coconut Beach hotel and definitely not enjoyed the hotel on so many levels. To begin with we requested our room to be ready for 3 pm arrival through the mobile ap and the room was not ready. It was not ready even 2 hours later. They welcomed us with the fact that this is not quite Sheraton hotel and we can not use our status privileges. No breakfast included and pretty much we should have been thankful that we had a room there. Very unpleasant and rude welcome to this hotel. We spend over 80 nights a year with Mariot and have never seen anything like that. Next day different crew and the breakfast was included for us. Lobby staff was very unaware and incompetent in their job based on our stay. Breakfast restaurant Overall very inconsistent service as well. Our lattes had different price every day although our order was exactly the same. The kids juices usually were served at the same time with the bill at the end of breakfast. Rooms I can not quite picture where the remodeling part was. The rooms needed a deep cleaning for sure it felt like whatever they have remodeled they just left and forgot to clean up before allowing people in. The beds are very soft and uncomfortable the pillows are extremely soft do not understand the purpose of it. The daily cleaning service included just the fix of our beds and fresh towels. For the 4 of us they were leaving only 2 towels no matter how many times we requested them to make a note that we need four. One or two towels every day had some kind of stain spots indicating they did not clean them properly. The hotel is on the windiest beach on the island. The beach is nice but you can not really enjoy it due to the wind. The wind never stopped for the entire time we were there. This might be a reason to the tree to be so leaning away towards the hotel. The beach is windy the pool side is windy as well you can not find a place to avoid it no matter where you go. The fire pits around the pool are lovely in the evening but again with so much wind is hard to enjoy even a single drink. The tiles around the pool the breakfast restaurant and the lobby was quite slippery. There were a lot of signs about that but that can not prevent slipping. Why they put such a slippery surface tiles when they remodeled the pool yard. Overall very disappointed stay at this hotel. Definitely the service was not up to SPG standards.
